alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Copiah; Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln; Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:04PM CST until January 24 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COPIAH, NORTHWESTERN SIMPSON, NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN, SOUTHEASTERN CLAIBORNE, FRANKLIN AND EASTERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 104 PM CST, emergency management reported flash flooding in the McCall Creek area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crystal Springs, Hazlehurst, Meadville, Bude, Roxie, Pleasant Hill, Allen, Caseyville, Mcbride, Union Church, Barlow, Peyton, Blue Hill, Mccall Creek, New Hope, Glancy, Dentville, Martinsville, Mcnair and Kirby. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

area.areaDesc: Claiborne; Copiah; Franklin; Jefferson; Lincoln; Simpson
